meanings.definition: Resembling a snake in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The long, snakish vines twisted around the tree.
meanings.sent2: Her snakish movements on the dance floor mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent3: The snakish pattern on his socks made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His snakish charm could sway even the toughest critics.
meanings.sent5: The snakish hiss sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics associated with snakes.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky fox had a snakish cunning about it.
meanings.sent2: The garden had a mysterious, snakish aura at night.
meanings.sent3: She joked about his snakish ability to slither out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The snakish pattern on her dress symbolized danger and allure.
meanings.sent5: His snakish gaze seemed to see right through her excuses.
